page.description: Assign a null value to any data type.

description.p: Returns a null value. Not supported for numeric Xbasic variables.

discussion.p: NULL_VALUE() is used in an Update Operation or an Xbasic script to assign null to a DBF field or Xbasic variable.
For example, to assign a NULL value to a DBF Field:

section.example: dim t as P t = table.open("orders") t.change_begin() t.date = NULL_VALUE() t.change_end(.T.) t.close()

important.p: *[xb:NULL_VALUE()]* cannot be used to set a null value in a SQL::Arguments object. Use [SQL::Arguments setNull()].

description.p: Numeric variables are a special case. You cannot use NULL_VALUE() with a numeric variable. However, if you have a numeric field in a DBF table, you can set the field value to NULL_VALUE().

section.example: dim t as P t = table.open("journal") ? t.PERIOD_YEAR = 34 t.change_begin() t.PERIOD_YEAR = NULL_VALUE() t.change_end(.t.) t.close() ? t.PERIOD_YEAR = 0

section.description: While the numeric field, *[xb:t.PERIOD_YEAR]*, reported 0 as it's value in the example above, if you look at the table in browse mode where NULL_VALUE() was assigned to a numeric field, no value will be visible in the field.

description.p: When assigned to an Xbasic variable, *[xb:NULL_VALUE()]* returns the following:

example.caption: Interactive Window results of assigning null_value() to Xbasic variables

p.example:
dim vA as a = null_value() ? vA = <Has no sub-properties>
dim vB as b = null_value() ? vB =
dim vC as c = null_value() ? vC = ""
dim vD as d = null_value() ? vD = { / / }
dim vF as f = null_value() ? vF = <No data returned>
dim vL as l = null_value() ? vL = .F.
dim vN as n = null_value() ? vN = 0
dim vP as p = null_value() ? vP = <Has no sub-properties>
dim vT as t = null_value() ? vT =
dim vU as u = null_value() ? vU = <Has no sub-properties>
